org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.mediation

Interface FileSupport


  • public interface FileSupport
    File, FTP, SFTP and FTPS transport related operations
    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getReceivedFileName(Message msg)
      Retrieves the filename from which this message has been constructed provided that this message is received via the file transport or as an AS2 message
      java.lang.String getReceivedFilePath(Message msg)
      Retrieves the file path from which this message has been constructed provided that this message is received via the file transport
      java.util.Collection listFiles(java.lang.String fileURL)
      Lists the files in the directory described by the given file path
      java.io.InputStream readFile(java.lang.String fileURL)
      Reads a file given by the file URL (including a SFTP, FTP or FTPS) into a stream
      java.lang.String readTextFile(java.lang.String fileURL)
      Reads a file in the given file URL as a text file into a String, using the platform encoding
      void setFileName(Message msg, java.lang.String fileName)
      Sets the name of the file to be used to send the message out via the file transport
      void storeMessage(Message msg, java.lang.String filePath)
      Stores the given message payload into a file described by the given file URL
      void writeTextFile(java.lang.String fileURL, java.lang.String content)
      A convenience mechanism to write a String to a file

    • Method Detail

      • getReceivedFileName

        java.lang.String getReceivedFileName(Message msg)
        Retrieves the filename from which this message has been constructed provided that this message is received via the file transport or as an AS2 message
        Parameters:
        msg - the message of which the received file name to be fetched
        Returns:
        the file name from which the message is constructed by the file transport

      • getReceivedFilePath

        java.lang.String getReceivedFilePath(Message msg)
        Retrieves the file path from which this message has been constructed provided that this message is received via the file transport
        Parameters:
        msg - the message of which the received file path to be fetched
        Returns:
        the file path from which the message is constructed by the file transport

      • setFileName

        void setFileName(Message msg,
               java.lang.String fileName)
        Sets the name of the file to be used to send the message out via the file transport
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to which the file name will be set
        fileName - the file name to be set

      • readFile

        java.io.InputStream readFile(java.lang.String fileURL)
                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads a file given by the file URL (including a SFTP, FTP or FTPS) into a stream
        Parameters:
        fileURL - the file URL to be read
        Returns:
        the input stream for the file URL
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be located

      • readTextFile

        java.lang.String readTextFile(java.lang.String fileURL)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a file in the given file URL as a text file into a String, using the platform encoding
        Parameters:
        fileURL - the file URL from which the file to be read
        Returns:
        the file content as a String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be located or read

      • writeTextFile

        void writeTextFile(java.lang.String fileURL,
                 java.lang.String content)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        A convenience mechanism to write a String to a file
        Parameters:
        fileURL - the file URL to which the payload should be written
        content - the String content to be written to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be located or written

      • storeMessage

        void storeMessage(Message msg,
                java.lang.String filePath)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Stores the given message payload into a file described by the given file URL
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to be stored into a file
        filePath - the path of the file to be used in storing the given message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file to be written cannot be located nor has permission issues

      • listFiles

        java.util.Collection listFiles(java.lang.String fileURL)
        Lists the files in the directory described by the given file path
        Parameters:
        fileURL - the file path of which the children files to be listed
        Returns:
        a collection of files in the specified directory path
